name: Terrapin Station Mandala Pin
description:

$120.00

Each hat design is a one of a kind, unique manifestation of divine energy translated into art and form. These sacred symbols represent the code and patterns constantly reoccurring in the universe, the fibers that weave our existence. This ancient technology is now emerging throughout the world to assist all life forms in returning home to eternal life here and now, giving us a vision of spiritual meaning and true freedom. These mandalas, yantras, sacred geometric patterns, symbols and colors when worn, can facilitate your own and others remembrance of our infinite stream of celestial source energy and potential that flows thru us all.

cleaning care: spot clean, do not wash in washing machine. can be varnished once a year with clear acrylic gloss varnish.

name: Hamsa Pin
description:
Elisa Rose Mountain x Michael Oprisko  collaboration

Limited Edition of 500 pieces

This doubled layered lapel pin features the Hamsa on the base layer. The top layer features a gold plated Tree of Life cut out which is securely riveted to the base layer. The back-stamp features both of the artist names as well as the number of the pin.

Dimension: 1.5" 
[this lapel pin features two back post]

FREE SHIPPING

description:

[this lapel pin features two back post]

name: Desert Portal Mandala Print
description:
This is a Photographic print 
-comes shipped with a matte board backing in a plastic sleeve.
Choose 8 x 10 or 11 x 14

name: SEED OF LIFE SPINNER
description:
This doubled layered lapel pin features a symmetrical circuit board design on the base layer. The top layer features a gold plated Seed of Life cut out which is able to spin on its center axis. The back-stamp features Metatron's Cube.

Dimension: 1.5" 
[this lapel pin features two back post]

name: Infinite Possibilites Snapback
description:
Front Panel:

The front features a star tetrahedron constructed out of the Sierpinski triangle fractal set.

Interior Liner:

The Asanoha, a traditional Japanese lattice patten representing the hemp leaf, is overlaid on an electric blue digital background.

Sweatband:

The five platonic solids are repeated along the length of the sweatband.

Visor:

The bottom visor features the Asanoha pattern embroidered on a light blue fabric.

Main Material: Acrylic & Wool Blend

name: Custom Hand painted Marbled Flat Brim with Bright colored Mandala with sacred Geometric Shapes
description:
Custom Hand painted Marbled Flat Brim with Bright colored Mandala with sacred Geometric Shapes

This is truely a one of kind hand painted hat... Not only is the hat marbled but handpainted in a unique design...

snapback

Marbled by Lisa's Lids and handpainted by Elisa Rose Mountain


varnished for weather

Each hat design is a one of a kind, unique manifestation of divine energy translated into art and form. These sacred symbols represent the code and patterns constantly reoccurring in the universe, the fibers that weave our existence. This ancient technology is now emerging throughout the world to assist all life forms in returning home to eternal life here and now, giving us a vision of spiritual meaning and true freedom. These mandalas, yantras, sacred geometric patterns, symbols and colors when worn, can facilitate your own and others remembrance of our infinite stream of celestial source energy and potential that flows thru us all.

cleaning care: spot clean, do not wash in washing machine. can be varnished once a year with clear acrylic gloss varnish.


If you would like to see more of my vision work you are welcome to visit my facebook for the most updated portfolio:

https://www.facebook.com/pages/The-Art-of-Elisa-Rose-Mountain

name: Wholesale Hamsa Tree of Life Pin
description:
10 pins for $100


Elisa Rose Mountain x Michael Oprisko  collaboration

Limited Edition of 500 pieces

This doubled layered lapel pin features the Hamsa on the base layer. The top layer features a gold plated Tree of Life cut out which is securely riveted to the base layer. The back-stamp features both of the artist names as well as the number of the pin.

Dimension: 1.5" 
[this lapel pin features two back post]

name: Custom Hand Painted Hat
description:
Once you place your order, specify your hat size (and any other details you want to tell me about your order) in a message. When your order is received, your hat will promptly be ordered directly (unless I have your size in stock!). Once your hat arrives (approximately 5-6 days), I allow 20 days for all paintwork on the custom designs. When your design is complete, your hat will be promptly mailed to you and . . Voila! You are enjoying custom hat like no other! :-) Whole process usually takes around 1-2 months.

Feel free to take a looksy around my 
facebook art page to see my full portfolio of hats and other artwork. 

https://www.facebook.com/pages/The-Art-of-Elisa-Rose-Mountain/135482539862261

Details should include: 
Hat style: flat brim, curve cap, trucker, fedora, etc. 
Hat size: fitted, snapback, flexfit
Color
Design ideas
color scheme

Price includes: Full Front and bottom brim design, see options below for hat brand options

Thanks and looking forward to creating you a one of a kind hand painted hat! Blessings... and remember :

Wherever your at, Wear a Hat!

name: Custom Wedding Mandala (Ketubah)
description:
Ketubah: Ketubah, (variously spelled ketuba, kettubah, katuba, katubah, and in the plural, ketubot, ketubbot and ketubahs) literally means "it is written." A marriage contract originating in the jewish culture but can be used for any wedding ceremony.  

When ordered: I will contact you about specifics.  Each custom Ketubah is hand painted and original. There are many choices involved.  Below are things to think about when we collaborate on your unique piece of art.  
 
Prices include:  only artwork.  You will either provide me with the written contract and I do the artwork around it or I can create one leaving space for the contract in any shape. 

Motif
List symbols that you want in your ketubah. Some commonly used symbols are:  ceremonial objects, clasped hands, animals (doves, sea horses, swans), trees and flowers,  patterns, celtic knots, henna style, lace, etc. Anything (within reason) can be a motif for a ketuba.

Color
What are your favorite colors? Least favorite? You might think in terms of temperature: cool colors (purples, blues, greens) or warm colors, (oranges, yellows, reds). Consider value--a light, pastel ketubah, or a darker, shaded kattubah. Do you like bright colors or do you want a more subtle effect in your marriage contract? You might want to pick out paint chips of colors you like.

Orientation
Do you want a horizontal, vertical, or circular ketubah? Or an irregular shape?  I can order any shape on archival paper or it can be painted on canvas. 

Timeliness
 I do rush orders at a 20% surcharge if all the necessary information is given to me less than 30 days before the wedding.
